message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY 

This paper deals with the analysis of media coverage and the biases that arise due to the subjective nature of filtering news. It proposes a methodology to capture the latent structure of media's decision process on a large scale. The paper uses personalization techniques to predict media coverage and evaluates its approach on a large set of events collected from the GDELT database. The paper also proposes a method to select a set of sources by leveraging the latent representation. Based on this, the likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing), and cs.CY (Computers and Society).
